title: How to Make Non Dairy Banana Ice Cream

steps.headline: Line the baking dish with parchment paper.
steps.description: This prevents the ice cream from sticking.

steps.headline: Cut the bananas and pit the dates.
Blend the bananas, dates and lemon juice together.
steps.description:
Blend until the mixture becomes smooth. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/32\/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/32\/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Pour the blended mixture into the lined baking dish.
Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Freeze for at least an hour.

steps.headline: Remove the baking dish from the freezer.
steps.description:
Separate the solid from the parchment paper. This is done very easily because the parchment paper prevents sticking. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Scoop out or cut the frozen banana ice cream to serve.

text:
Line the baking dish with parchment paper. This prevents the ice cream from sticking. Cut the bananas and pit the dates. Blend the bananas, dates and lemon juice together. Blend until the mixture becomes smooth. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pour the blended mixture into the lined baking dish. Place in the freezer. Freeze for at least an hour. Remove the baking dish from the freezer. Separate the solid from the parchment paper. This is done very easily because the parchment paper prevents sticking. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Non-Dairy-Banana-Ice-Cream-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Scoop out or cut the frozen banana ice cream to serve.
